# get_mae { #reportrabbit.get_mae }

```python
get_mae(y_true, y_pred)
```

Calculates the Mean Absolute Error (MAE) and returns the result.

MAE measures the average absolute difference between the
observed values and the predicted values.

## Parameters {.doc-section .doc-section-parameters}

| Name   | Type   | Description                                | Default    |
|--------|--------|--------------------------------------------|------------|
| y_true | array  | The actual observed values (ground truth). | _required_ |
| y_pred | array  | The model predicted values.                | _required_ |

## Returns {.doc-section .doc-section-returns}

| Name   | Type   | Description                         |
|--------|--------|-------------------------------------|
|        | float  | The calculated Mean Absolute Error. |

## Examples {.doc-section .doc-section-examples}

```python
>>> y_true = [1.0, 2.0, 3.0]
>>> y_pred = [2.0, 2.0, 4.0]
>>> get_mae(y_true, y_pred)
0.6666666666666666
```
